instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers up no chime or display, question on power rail variations
threads.message: Hi, ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers up no chime or display ive checked every power rail and all are correct except some variations on <SIGNAL>PP1V35_GPU_REG</SIGNAL> which should be 1.35v and i have 1.48v, <SIGNAL>PPVDDC1_SO_ISENSE</SIGNAL> should be 1.12v and i have 0.9v and <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> which should be 1v and i have 0.84v could this be enough of a difference to cause a problem ?? , i did have a look at <SIGNAL>PP1V35_GPU_REG</SIGNAL> and found that the voltage at L8710 should be 1.05v according to the schematic but i have 1.48v , could this mean that <TRANSISTOR>Q8710</TRANSISTOR> or <CHIP>U8700</CHIP> could be at fault or is the schematic off on voltage and im just gonna get headache :-) P.S this board has no signs of any damage anywhere

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers up no chime or display, question on power rail variations
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers up no chime or display, question on power rail variations
threads.message: Hi yes thats the first thing i done but no joy :-(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers up no chime or display, question on power rail variations
threads.message: CPU Vcore present? Without any history on this board this one will suck. See if this thing is <2 years old, if you are in the EU Apple will fix it under warranty.
